messages.message:
hi, two questions
1. Do we have an automatic garbage collection service that deletes old uploads?
2. (If not) Currently, customers go through a 3 step process to run files into compiled apps; Upload file to specified folder > Run Solution > Get Solution Results. We have got queries around completing the process with a 4th step i.e; deleting the uploaded files stored in Instabase. How are we able to support this?
There doesnt seem to be a delete file/folder API as part of the Postman collection, so im curious how we should respond to these cc @fernando.piazza.ctr
Thanks @Léo that would be my next question i.e; how are we GDPR compliant in this case

The answer will be that GDPR customers would have to use the API to remove data in case of deletion request or use their drive and manage like that. As of now there are UI (as far as I know) to delete job results. cc @Lee  ( I can create a tickertfor that if you want)
Yes please, I don’t think we have a ticket open for this right now
Thanks Leo. @Lee re-number 2; API to delete file/folders, have you seen/dealt with similar requests?
Not in AI Hub, but in theory the APIs are still there from Enterprise
If they have their own S3 they can delete without our APIs
